applicability_reasoning: This regulation clearly applies to the document for several key reasons: 1) The document is a pension life cover scheme rules document issued by AIB life, which is explicitly stated to be regulated by the Central Bank of Ireland (as noted at the end of the document). 2) The document outlines detailed rules and procedures for managing pension benefits and trustee responsibilities, which directly relates to the regulation's requirement to 'act with due skill, care and diligence.' 3) The document demonstrates compliance with this regulation through multiple sections showing careful consideration of trustee duties, administrative procedures, and risk management, particularly in Sections 4 (Trustee Duties and Powers) and 2.4 (Revenue Commissioners' approval and maximum benefits). 4) The document includes specific provisions for ensuring appropriate knowledge and management of activities (Section 4.1 on Trustee as Administrator), which directly aligns with regulation requirement 7(a). 5) The document shows compliance with financial services legislation (including Pensions Act references) and market conduct standards, which aligns with requirements 7(b) and 7(c) of the regulation.
regulation_title: Acting with due skill, care and diligence
regulation_text:
7. Without prejudice to the generality of Regulation 4(1)(c), a regulated 
entity shall act with due skill, care and diligence, including by:  
(a) ensuring that persons who are responsible for managing the 
activities of the regulated entity have appropriate knowledge of 
the activities and associated risks that apply in the conduct of its 
affairs;  
(b) complying with all financial services legislation applicable to the 
conduct of its affairs;  
(c) operating in compliance with standards of market conduct and 
trading venue rules to which the regulated entity is subject by law 
and any market codes that apply to the affairs of the regulated 
entity.
source_name: CENTRAL BANK REFORM ACT 2010 (SECTION 17A) (STANDARDS FOR BUSINESS) REGULATIONS 2025
